title: Graphs
text: ReboundTools R package provides functions analyze energy rebound, unanticipated reduction benefits energy efficiency due behavior change economy-wide effects. Many functions (described ReboundTools vignette) perform analysis calculations move known parameters rebound estimates. Graphing functions create rebound path graphs energy, expenditure, consumption spaces. graphing functions create sensitivity graphs. functions package used analyses graphs paper **********.

title: Graphs
text: Rebound graphs can created path_graphs() function. Three types rebound graphs available: Energy paths, Expenditure paths, Consumption paths. graph_type argument path_graphs() controls type path graph returned (one “Energy”, “Expenditure”, “Consumption”). default, three graph types returned. cases argument determines cases plotted. default, cases returned.

title: Graphs
text: energy path graph shows energy effects energy efficiency upgrade, direct energy consumption horizontal axis indirect energy consumption vertical axis. Diagonal lines negative slope indicate lines constant energy consumption. thicker lines show 0 % rebound (lower left) 100 % rebound (upper right). Thinner lines show rebound effect order 0 % line 100 % line: emplacement, substitution, income, macro. following example illustrates energy path graph.
code: load_eeu_data() %>%    rebound_analysis() %>%    path_graphs(cases = "Car", graph_types = "Energy") +   ggplot2::theme_classic()

title: Graphs
text: expenditure path graph shows expenditures rebound effects. Direct expenditures energy service (including substitution income takebacks) shown horizontal axis; capital expenditures, maintenance disposal expenditures, substitution effect savings, income effect expenditures shown vertical axis. Diagonal lines negative slope indicate lines constant expenditure. lower-left line indicates expected expenditure options capital expenditure changes, maintenance expenditure changes, behavior changes. Note beginning (dot) end (arrow) expenditure path lie expenditure line, indicating freed cash (emplacement substitution effects) re-spent income effect.
code: load_eeu_data() %>%    rebound_analysis() %>%  path_graphs(cases = "Car", graph_types = "Expenditure") +   ggplot2::theme_classic()

title: Graphs
text: consumption path graph shows details substitution income effects, normalized energy service consumption horizontal axis normalized expenditures goods vertical axis. Diagonal grid lines negative slope indicate constant expenditure sum energy service (horizontal axis) goods (vertical axis). Negative-sloping lines show tradeoff consumption energy service (horizontal axis) consumption goods (vertical axis). swooping, concave-upward grid lines indicate lines constant utility: indifference curves.
code: load_eeu_data() %>%    rebound_analysis() %>%    path_graphs(cases = "Car", graph_types = "Consumption") +   ggplot2::xlim(0.995, 1.06) +    ggplot2::ylim(0.995, 1.04) +   ggplot2::theme_classic()

title: Graphs
text: addition graph_types cases arguments, following arguments adjust composition appearance graphs: indexed, graph_types, grid_types, graph_params.

previous_headings: Rebound path graphs > Arguments to path_graphs()
title: Graphs
text: Setting indexed = TRUE normalizes rebound data conditions emplacement energy efficient device, starting point always (1, 1).  discussed , cases argument tells Cases plotted. cases plotted default, although result rarely pleasing.  cases overlapping different (), faceting indexing may improve appearance graph.
code: load_eeu_data() %>%    rebound_analysis() %>%    path_graphs(indexed = TRUE, cases = "Car", graph_types = "Energy") +   ggplot2::theme_classic() load_eeu_data() %>%    rebound_analysis() %>%    path_graphs(cases = c("Car", "Lamp"),                     graph_types = "Energy") +   ggplot2::theme_classic() load_eeu_data() %>%    rebound_analysis() %>%    path_graphs(indexed = TRUE,                    graph_types = ReboundTools::graph_types$energy) +     ggplot2::facet_wrap(facets = ReboundTools::eeu_base_params$case) +   ggplot2::theme_classic()

title: Graphs
text: Sensitivity graphs can created sensitivity_graphs() function. named list sensitivity parameters required. graphs easiest described via examples. first example shows sensitivity total rebound (RetotRe_{tot}) macro parameter (kk).  next example shows multi-variate sensitivity. Values macro parameter (kk) shown rows lattice plot. Uncompensated price elasticity energy service consumption (ϵq̇s,ps\epsilon_{\dot{q}_s,p_s}) shown columns lattice plot. Total rebound (RetotRe_{tot}) given yy-axis, energy intensity economy (IEI_E) given xx-axis. cases (Car Lamp) shown different lines.  third sensitivity example shows
code: df <- load_eeu_data() sens_params <- list(Car = list(k = seq(0.5, 1.5, by = 0.5)),                      Lamp = list(k = seq(0, 2, by = 1))) sensitivity_graphs(rebound_data = df, parameterization = sens_params,                     x_var = "k", y_var = "Re_tot") +   ggplot2::facet_wrap(facets = "Case", scales = "free_x") +   ggplot2::scale_colour_manual(values = c(Re_tot = "black"), guide = "none") +    ggplot2::scale_discrete_manual(aesthetics = "linewidth", values = c(Re_tot = 0.5), guide = "none") +    ggplot2::scale_linetype_manual(values = c(Re_tot = "solid"), guide = "none") +   ggplot2::labs(y = expression(Re[tot]),                  colour = ggplot2::element_blank(),                 size = ggplot2::element_blank(),                 linetype = ggplot2::element_blank()) +   ggplot2::theme_classic() sens_params_2 <- list(Car = list(k = seq(0, 2, by = 0.5),                                   I_E = seq(2, 5, by = 1),                                   e_qs_ps_UC_orig = seq(-0.5, -0.1, by = 0.1)),                        Lamp = list(k = seq(0, 2, by = 0.5),                                   I_E = seq(2, 5, by = 1),                                    e_qs_ps_UC_orig = seq(-0.5, -0.1, by = 0.1))) # Choose which rebound variables to include and their order. sensitivity_graphs(rebound_data = df, parameterization = sens_params_2,                     x_var = "I_E",                     y_var = "Re_tot",                    line_var = "Case") +   ggplot2::facet_grid(rows = ggplot2::vars(k),                        cols = ggplot2::vars(e_qs_ps_UC_orig), scales = "free_y") +   ggplot2::scale_colour_manual(values = c(Car = "black", Lamp = "red")) +    ggplot2::scale_discrete_manual(aesthetics = "linewidth", values = c(Car = 0.5, Lamp = 1.0)) +    ggplot2::scale_linetype_manual(values = c(Car = "solid", Lamp = "dashed")) +    ggplot2::labs(colour = ggplot2::element_blank(),                  size = ggplot2::element_blank(),                 linetype = ggplot2::element_blank(),                  linewidth = ggplot2::element_blank()) +   ggplot2::theme_classic() sens_params_3 <- list(Car = list(eta_engr_units_star = seq(35, 50, by = 0.5)),                        Lamp = list(eta_engr_units_star = seq(70, 90, by = 5))) # Choose rebound terms to include in the graph and their order rebound_vars <- c("Re_dempl", "Re_emb", "Re_omd", "Re_dsub", "Re_isub",                    "Re_dinc", "Re_iinc", "Re_macro")  sensitivity_graphs(rebound_data = df, parameterization = sens_params_3,                    x_var = "eta_engr_units_tilde",                     y_var = rebound_vars) +    ggplot2::facet_wrap(facets = "Case", scales = "free_x") +   ggplot2::scale_colour_manual(values =                                   c(Re_dempl = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$dempl_colour,                                    Re_emb = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$emb_colour,                                    Re_omd = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$md_colour,                                     Re_dsub = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$dsub_colour,                                    Re_isub = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$isub_colour,                                     Re_dinc = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$dinc_colour,                                    Re_iinc = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$iinc_colour,                                    Re_macro = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$macro_colour),                                 breaks = rebound_vars) +   ggplot2::scale_discrete_manual(aesthetics = "linewidth",                                   values =                                     c(Re_dempl = 0.2,                                       Re_emb = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$emb_linewidth,                                      Re_omd = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$md_linewidth,                                       Re_dsub = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$dsub_linewidth,                                      Re_isub = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$isub_linewidth,                                       Re_dinc = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$dinc_linewidth,                                      Re_iinc = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$iinc_linewidth,                                      Re_macro = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$macro_linewidth),                                   breaks = rebound_vars) +   ggplot2::scale_linetype_manual(values =                                     c(Re_dempl = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$dempl_linetype,                                       Re_emb = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$emb_linetype,                                      Re_omd = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$md_linetype,                                      Re_dsub = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$dsub_linetype,                                      Re_isub = "11", title: Graphs
text: ReboundTools package assists analyzing rebound effects displaying results. particular, path_graphs() function returns ggplot2 objects show rebound path graphs sensitivity_graphs() function returns ggplot2 objects show sensitivity analyses. Taken together, functions provide important capabilities analyze rebound effects energy efficiency upgrades.

title: ReboundTools
text: ReboundTools R package provides functions analyze energy rebound, unanticipated reduction benefits energy efficiency due behavior change economy-wide effects. Many functions perform analysis calculations move known parameters rebound estimates. Graphing functions (described Graphs vignette) create rebound path graphs energy, expenditure, consumption spaces. graphing functions create sensitivity graphs. functions package used analyses graphs paper **********.

title: ReboundTools
text: first step rebound analysis specifying parameters energy efficiency upgrade (EEU) rebound analysis, typically Excel spreadsheet. path example spreadsheet can found function sample_eeu_data_path(). Data can loaded data frame follows: Variable names (columns EEU spreadsheet) described various constants package, including eeu_base_params, key_analysis_vars, rebound_stages. Get help constants see descriptions parameters, variables, stages. Rows EEU spreadsheet describe cases analyzed. example file sample_eeu_data_path() contains two cases: car electric lamp. Columns EEU spreadsheet contain rebound parameters case. Required columns shown example file eeu_data data frame. Rows can used sensitivity analysis, varying one many parameters row spreadsheet.

title: ReboundTools
text: data loaded, rebound analyses can performed. rebound analysis consists calculating rebound terms intermediate results, row EEU data frame. convenient function perform rebound analysis named, aptly, rebound_analysis(). Columns intermediate final results added right data frame. Note rebound_analysis() convenience function calls several helper functions turn. helper function calculates rebound parameters one rebound effects.

title: ReboundTools
text: ReboundTools contains two functions create tables: stages_table() rebound_results_table().

title: ReboundTools
text: rebound analysis performed, results can displayed stages table, rebound parameters rows rebound stages columns.
code: digs <- matrix(c(rep(1, 7),  # t_life                  rep(1, 7),  # R_alpha                  rep(1, 7),  # R_omega                  rep(1, 7),  # eta_engr_units                  rep(3, 7),  # eta                  rep(3, 7),  # p_s                  rep(0, 7),  # q_dot_s                  rep(4, 7),  # p_E                  rep(0, 7),  # E_dot_s                  rep(0, 7),  # E_dot_emb                  rep(0, 7),  # C_dot_s                  rep(0, 7),  # C_dot_cap                  rep(0, 7),  # R_alpha_C_dot_cap                  rep(0, 7),  # C_dot_om                  rep(1, 7),  # C_d                  rep(2, 7),  # C_dot_d                  rep(2, 7),  # R_omega_D_dot_d                  rep(0, 7),  # C_dot_omd                  rep(0, 7),  # C_dot_o                  rep(0, 7),  # N_dot                  rep(0, 7)), # M_dot                nrow = 21, ncol = 7, byrow = TRUE) load_eeu_data() %>%    dplyr::filter(.data[[ReboundTools::eeu_base_params$case]] == "Car") %>%    dplyr::mutate(     Case = NULL   ) %>%    rebound_analysis() %>%    stages_table(digits = digs,                 align = "lrrrrrr") %>%    print(type = "html",         include.rownames = FALSE,          booktabs = TRUE,         caption.placement = "top",         sanitize.text.function = function(x) {x},         format.args = list(big.mark = ","))

title: ReboundTools
text: Rebound analysis results can also displayed rebound results table. rebound results table shows rebound terms values.
code: load_eeu_data() %>%    dplyr::filter(Case == "Car") %>%    rebound_analysis() %>%    dplyr::mutate(     Case = NULL   ) %>%   ReboundTools::rebound_results_table(include_subtotals = FALSE,                                        label = "tab:car_results",                                        digits = 1,                                        align = "rrr") %>%    print(type = "html",         include.rownames = FALSE,          booktabs = TRUE,         caption.placement = "top",         hline.after = c(-1, 0, nrow(.)-1, nrow(.)),         sanitize.text.function = function(x) {x},         format.args = list(big.mark = ","))

title: ReboundTools
text: ReboundTools package assists analyzing rebound effects displaying results. particular, rebound_analysis() function performs rebound analysis energy efficiency upgrades stages_table() function returns xtable object suitable inclusion papers reports, Taken together, functions provide important capabilities analyze rebound effects energy efficiency upgrades.

what: Analyze and Display Estimates of Energy Rebound
title: Analyze and Display Estimates of Energy Rebound
text: ReboundTools R package provides functions analyze energy rebound, unanticipated reduction benefits energy efficiency due behavior change economy-wide effects. Many functions perform analysis calculations move known parameters rebound estimates. Graphing functions (described Graphs vignette) create rebound path graphs energy, expenditure, consumption spaces. graphing functions create sensitivity graphs. functions package used analyses graphs paper comprehensive, partial-equilibrium energy rebound analysis framework Matthew Kuperus Heun, Gregor Semieniuk, Paul Brockway, 2021.

title: Analyze and Display Estimates of Energy Rebound
text: can install IEATools github :
code: # install devtools if not already installed # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("MatthewHeun/ReboundTools") # To build vignettes locally, use devtools::install_github("MatthewHeun/ReboundTools", build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Analyze and Display Estimates of Energy Rebound

title: ReboundTools: Analyze and Display Estimates of Energy Rebound — ReboundTools-package
text: Energy rebound unanticipated reduction benefits energy efficiency due behavior change economy-wide effects. `ReboundTools` provides assistance energy rebound analysis. Many functions perform analysis calculations move known parameters rebound estimates. functions create rebound graphs energy, expenditure, consumption spaces. functions package used analyses graphs paper "comprehensive, partial-equilibrium energy rebound analysis framework".

title: Add an indifference curve to a data frame — add_indifference_curve
text: consumption path graph always indexed, indexed argument. function finds reasonable range sweep qs_qs0 variable generating indifference curve, depending value qs2_qs0. qs2_qs0 NULL (default), curve generated range grqph_params$qs_qs0_lower * qs1_qs0 grqph_params$qs_qs0_upper * qs1_qs0. qs2_qs0 non-NULL, curve generated range grqph_params$qs_qs0_lower * min(qs1_qs0, qs2_qs0) grqph_params$qs_qs0_upper * max(qs1_qs0, qs2_qs0).

title: EEU bar data — bar_vars
text: list derived variables bar stage (income effect) rebound analysis.

title: EEU bar data — bar_vars
code: bar_vars

title: EEU bar data — bar_vars
text: string list 26 entries. tau_alpha_bar post-income effect discount multiplier beginning--life expenses, capital cost. tau_alpha_hat. tau_omega_bar post-income effect discount multiplier end--life expenses, disposal cost. tau_omega_hat. eta_bar Energy service efficiency upgraded (post-EEU) device per-MJ basks [service/MJ], exactly eta_hat. p_s_bar energy service price income effect [$/service], exactly p_s_hat. C_dot_cap_bar capital expenditure rate device without discounting [$/yr], calculated C_cap/t_life. tau_alpha_C_dot_cap_bar product tau_alpha undiscounted capital cost rate, annualized discounted [$/yr]. C_dot_om_bar operations maintenance expenditure rate device [$/yr]. C_d_bar disposal cost device [$/yr]. C_dot_d_bar disposal cost rate device without discounting [$/yr]. tau_omega_C_dot_d_bar product tau_omega undiscounted disposal cost rate, annualized discounted [$/yr]. C_dot_omd_bar operations, maintenance, disposal expenditure rate device [$/yr]. E_dot_emb_bar embodied energy rate income effect [MJ/yr], exactly E_dot_emb_hat. M_dot_bar Real income income effect [MJ/yr], exactly M_dot_hat. q_dot_s_bar rate energy service consumption income effect\ [service/yr], calculated (1 + N_dot_hat/M_dot_hat_prime)^(e_qs_M). C_dot_g_bar rate goods expenditures income effect [$/yr], calculated (1 + N_dot_hat/M_dot_hat_prime)^(e_qg_M). f_Cs_bar post-income effect fraction energy budget spent energy service [–], calculated C_dot_s_star / (C_dot_s_star + C_dot_g_star). e_qs_ps_C_bar post-income effect compensated energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") energy service ("qs") consumption [–], calculated e_qs_ps_UC_orig + f_Cs_orig*e_qs_M. e_qg_ps_C_bar post-income effect compensated energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") goods ("qo") consumption [–], calculated f_Cs_orig*(f_Cs_orig + e_qs_ps_UC_orig) / (f_Cs_orig - 1). e_qs_ps_UC_bar post-income effect uncompensated ("UC") Marshallian energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") energy service ("qs") consumption (-price elasticity) [–]. e_qg_ps_UC_bar post-income effect uncompensated ("UC") Marshallian energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") goods ("qo") consumption (cross-price elasticity) [–]. p_E_bar price energy [$/MJ], N_dot_bar freed cash rate income effect [$/yr], exactly 0. title: EEU base parameters — eeu_base_params
text: list required parameters rebound analysis. parameters must supplied rebound analysis commence. names list assumed names throughout package, can always overridden function arguments.

title: EEU base parameters — eeu_base_params
code: eeu_base_params

title: EEU base parameters — eeu_base_params
text: string list 14 entries. reference string reference case, e.g. bibliographic entry paper case appears. case string identify case analyzed, e.g., "Lamp". original string identify original device, e.g., "Incandescent". upgrade string identify upgraded device, e.g., "LED". r discount rate, units 1/year. E.g., 3.0% entered 0.03. service_unit string identify unit energy service, e.g., "miles" "miles/gal" "lm-hr" "lm-hr/kW-hr". energy_engr_unit string identify energy units service, e.g., "gal" "miles/gal" "kW-hr" "lm-hr/kW-hr". MJ_engr_unit unit conversion factor: number MJ per engineering unit service efficiency. example, service efficiency given miles/gallon, MJ_engr_unit 126.6 MJ/gallon. unit conversion number used calculating actual service efficiency. I_E energy intensity economy [MJ/$]. k macro effect factor [–]. p_E_engr_units price energy engineering units, e.g., $/gal $/kW-hr [$/energy_engr_unit]. e_qs_ps_UC_orig original uncompensated ("UC") Marshallian energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") energy service ("qs") consumption (-price elasticity) [–]. e_qs_M income ("M") elasticity ("e") energy service ("qs") consumption [–]. e_qg_M income ("M") elasticity ("e") goods ("qo") consumption [–].

title: EEU base parameters — eeu_base_params
text: descriptions parameter, typical units provided energy efficiency upgrades cars electric lamps. Note following meanings default parameter names: orig original device, prior EEU. star emplacement effect substitution effect. hat substitution effect income effect. bar income effect macro effect. tilde macro effect. economic intensity (per $). p Price. E Energy, typically final energy. s Energy service. o goods. eps Elasticity. UC Uncompensated. dot Signifies rate, typically per yr. q Quantity energy service goods consumed. M Income. C Cost. t Expected device lifetime.

Cg1_Cg0_col name column containing C_g/C_g_0 point indifference curve. f_Cs_orig_col name column containing original value f_Cs indifference curve. sigma_col name column containing ending sigma values indifference curve. start_point_col name boolean column telling whether row contains segment starting point. end_arrow_col name boolean column telling whether row contains segment ending arrow. title: EEU hat data — hat_vars

title: EEU hat data — hat_vars
text: string list 28 entries. tau_alpha_hat post-substitution effect discount multiplier beginning--life expenses, capital cost. tau_alpha_star. tau_omega_hat post-substitution effect discount multiplier end--life expenses, disposal cost. tau_omega_star. eta_hat Energy service efficiency upgraded (post-EEU) device per-MJ basks [service/MJ], exactly eta_star. p_s_hat energy service price substitution effect [$/service], exactly p_s_star. C_dot_cap_hat capital expenditure rate device without discounting [$/yr], calculated C_cap/t_life. tau_alpha_C_dot_cap_hat product tau_alpha undiscounted capital cost rate, annualized discounted [$/yr]. C_dot_om_hat operations maintenance expenditure rate device [$/yr]. C_d_hat disposal cost device [$/yr]. C_dot_d_hat disposal cost rate device without discounting [$/yr]. tau_omega_C_dot_d_hat product tau_omega undiscounted disposal cost rate, annualized discounted [$/yr]. C_dot_omd_hat operations, maintenance, disposal expenditure rate device [$/yr]. E_dot_emb_hat embodied energy rate substitution effect [MJ/yr], exactly E_dot_emb_star. M_dot_hat Real income substitution effect [MJ/yr], exactly M_dot_star. q_dot_s_hat rate energy service consumption substitution effect\ [service/yr], calculated q_dot_s_star * eta_ratio^(-e_qs_ps_C). p_E_hat price energy [$/MJ]. E_dot_s_hat rate energy consumption substitution effect\ [service/yr], calculated q_dot_s_hat / eta_hat. C_dot_g_hat rate goods expenditures substitution effect [$/yr], calculated C_dot_g_star * eta_ratio^(-e_qo_ps_C). f_Cs_hat post-substitution effect fraction energy budget spent energy service [–], calculated C_dot_s_star / (C_dot_s_star + C_dot_g_star). e_qs_ps_C_hat post-substitution effect compensated energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") energy service ("qs") consumption [–], calculated e_qs_ps_UC_orig + f_Cs_orig*e_qs_M. e_qg_ps_C_hat post-substitution effect compensated energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") goods ("qo") consumption [–], calculated f_Cs_orig*(f_Cs_orig + e_qs_ps_UC_orig) / (f_Cs_orig - 1). e_qs_ps_UC_hat post-substitution effect uncompensated ("UC") Marshallian energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") energy service ("qs") consumption (-price elasticity) [–]. e_qg_ps_UC_hat post-substitution effect uncompensated ("UC") Marshallian energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") goods ("qo") consumption (cross-price elasticity) [–]. N_dot_hat freed cash rate [$/yr], calculated G_dot - (C_dot_cap_star - C_dot_cap_orig) - (C_dot_md_star - C_dot_md_orig). M_dot_hat_prime Modified M_dot income effect [$/yr], calculated M_dot_hat - C_dot_cap_orig - C_dot_md_orig - G_dot + p_E*(E_dot_s_hat - E_dot_s_star) + (C_dot_g_hat - C_dot_g_star) [service/yr]: R:service/yr%5C [service/yr]: R:service/yr%5C

title: An indifference curve — indifference_func
text: function gives points along indifference curve (q_dot_s/q_dot_s_orig, C_dot_o/C_dot_g_orig) space. indifference curve assumes CES utility. equation indifference curve u_dot/u_dot_orig = [f_Cs*(q_dot_s/q_dot_s_orig)^rho + (1-f_Cs)*(C_dot_o/C_dot_g_orig)^rho]^(1/rho).

title: An indifference curve — indifference_func
code: indifference_func(   qs_qs0,   qs1_qs0,   Cg1_Cg0,   f_Cs_orig,   sigma,   rho = (sigma - 1)/sigma )

title: An indifference curve — indifference_func
text: qs_qs0 ratio q_dot_s/q_dot_s_orig. Sweeping variable (x) gives indifference curve parameterized arguments. qs1_qs0 x coordinate point indifference curve. Cg1_Cg0 y coordinate point indifference curve. f_Cs_orig fraction original spending energy service relative sum energy service goods spending, calculated C_dot_s_orig / (C_dot_s_orig + C_dot_g_orig). sigma elasticity substitution energy service goods. rho exponent CES utility function. Default (sigma-1)/sigma.

title: EEU orig data — orig_vars

title: EEU orig data — orig_vars
text: string list 31 entries. tau_alpha_orig original discount multiplier beginning--life expenses, capital cost. tau_omega_orig original discount multiplier end--life expenses, disposal cost. p_E price energy [$/MJ], calculated p_E_engr_units / MJ_engr_unit. p_E_orig price energy [$/MJ]. q_dot_s_orig original (pre-EEU) consumption rate energy service. Example units [miles/yr] [lumen-hours/yr]. C_cap_orig net capital expenditure original device: sum purchase price financing costs less rebates resale value end ownership [$]. M_dot_orig disposable income rate, exclusive taxes savings [$/yr]. eta_engr_units_orig original (pre-EEU) energy service efficiency.  number engineering units denominator, e.g., [miles/gallon] [lumens/kW]. Note denominator unit eta_engr_units_orig assumed denominator unit MJ_engr_unit. eta_orig Energy service efficiency original (pre-EEU) device per-MJ basis [service/MJ], calculated eta_engr_units_orig / MJ_engr_unit. E_dot_s_orig final energy consumption rate original (pre-EEU) device [MJ/yr], calculated q_dot_s_orig / eta_orig. C_dot_cap_orig capital expenditure rate device without discounting [$/yr], calculated C_cap/t_own. tau_alpha_C_dot_cap_orig product tau_alpha undiscounted capital cost rate, annualized discounted [$/yr]. C_dot_om_orig operations maintenance expenditure rate device [$/yr]. C_d_orig disposal cost device [$/yr]. C_dot_d_orig disposal cost rate device without discounting [$/yr]. tau_omega_C_dot_d_orig product tau_omega undiscounted disposal cost rate, annualized discounted [$/yr]. C_dot_omd_orig operations, maintenance, disposal expenditure rate device [$/yr]. p_s_orig original (pre-EEU) energy service price [$/service], calculated p_E / eta_orig. C_dot_s_orig original (pre-EEU) rate energy expenditures device [$/yr], calculated p_E * E_dot_s_orig. C_dot_g_orig original (pre-EEU) rate expenditure goods [$/yr], calculated M_dot_orig - C_dot_s_orig - C_dot_cap_orig - C_dot_md_orig. f_Cs_orig original (pre-EEU) fraction energy budget spent energy service [–], calculated C_dot_s_orig / (C_dot_s_orig + C_dot_g_orig). e_qs_ps_C_orig original compensated energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") energy service ("qs") consumption [–], calculated e_qs_ps_UC_orig + f_Cs_orig*e_qs_M. e_qg_ps_C_orig original compensated energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") goods ("qo") consumption [–], calculated f_Cs_orig*(f_Cs_orig + e_qs_ps_UC_orig) / (f_Cs_orig - 1). e_qg_ps_UC_orig original uncompensated ("UC") Marshallian energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") goods ("qo") consumption (cross-price elasticity) [–]. sigma elasticity substitution energy service consumption goods consumption [–]. rho exponent CES utility model, defined rho = 1/sigma - 1 [–]. E_emb_orig embodied energy original (pre-EEU) device [MJ]. t_life_orig expected lifetime original (pre-EEU) device [yr]. E_dot_emb_orig original (pre-EEU) rate embodied energy demand[MJ/yr], calculated E_dot_emb / t_orig. N_dot_orig original (pre-EEU) freed cash rate [$/yr], exactly 0.

size emplacement lines. dsub_size size direct substitution lines. isub_size size indirect substitution lines. sub_size size substitution lines. dinc_size size direct income lines. iinc_size size indirect income lines. inc_size size income lines. macro_size size macro lines. dir_size size direct lines. indir_size size indirect lines. tot_size size total rebound lines. dempl_linetyps linetype lines. iinc_linetype linetype indirect income lines. inc_linetype linetype income lines. macro_linetype linetype macro lines. dir_linetype linetype direct lines. indir_linetype linetype indirect lines. tot_linetype linetype total rebound lines. lineend line end style. linejoin line join style. reverse_path_drawing_order Tells whether reverse drawing order paths. default (FALSE) draws Set NULL eliminate grids. graph_params string list parameters control appearance graph. Default ReboundTools::path_graph_params, can modified passed argument control graph appearance. case_colname name Case column .rebound_data. Default ReboundTools::eeu_base_params$case. rebound_stages See ReboundTools::rebound_stages. rebound_segments See ReboundTools::rebound_segments. graph_df_colnames names column names data frames graph data. Default ReboundTools::graph_df_colnames.

title: Build a rebound results table — rebound_results_table
text: .analysis_data Rebound analysis results. Probably output call rebound_analysis(). escape_latex TRUE (default), return LaTeX-compatible versions strings. include_subtotals Tells whether include rebound subtotals stage direct/indirect. Default TRUE. include_total Tells whether include rebound total. Default TRUE. as_percent TRUE, rebound results reported percentages. FALSE, rebound results reported fractions. Default TRUE. rebound_terms See ReboundTools::rebound_terms. latex_rebound_terms See ReboundTools::latex_rebound_terms. case See ReboundTools::eeu_base_params. subtotals rebound terms represent subtotals. Default c(ReboundTools::rebound_terms$Re_empl, ReboundTools::rebound_terms$Re_sub, ReboundTools::rebound_terms$Re_inc, ReboundTools::rebound_terms$Re_dir, ReboundTools::rebound_terms$Re_indir, ReboundTools::rebound_terms$Re_micro). total rebound term represents total rebound. Default ReboundTools::rebound_terms$Re_tot. term_name title rebound term column. Default "Rebound term". latex_term_name LaTeX term name column. Default "LaTeX rebound term". Re_val_colname title rebound value column. Default "Value [–]". perc_Re_val_colname title rebound value column percentages requested. Default "Value [%]". latex_Re_val_colname LaTeX rebound value column name. Default "Value [–]". latex_perc_Re_val_colname LaTeX rebound value column name percentages requested. Default "Value [\%]". ... Arguments passed xtable::xtable(), possibly label, caption, digits, etc.

title: Rebound terms — rebound_terms
text: string list 18 entries. Re_dempl Direct emplacement effect rebound, always 0. Re_emb Indirect embodied energy effect rebound. Re_cap Indirect capital expenditure effect rebound. Re_om Indirect operations maintenance expenditure effect rebound. Re_d Indirect disposal effect rebound. Re_omd Indirect operations, maintenance, disposal effect rebound. Re_empl Emplacement effect rebound. Re_dsub Direct substitution effect rebound. Re_isub Indirect substitution effect rebound. Re_sub Substitution effect rebound. Re_dinc Direct income effect rebound. Re_iinc Indirect income effect rebound. Re_inc Income effect rebound. Re_micro Sum micro rebound effects. Re_macro Indirect macro effect rebound. Re_dir Sum direct rebound effects. Re_indir Sum indirect rebound effects. Re_tot Total rebound.

text: .parametric_data data frame, likely result calling parametric_analysis(). Default parametric_analysis(rebound_data, parameterization). rebound_data Rebound data, likely read load_eeu_data(). Default NULL. parameterization list lists gives parameter sweeps. top level, list items must named cases rebound_data. next level, parameters swept given, along sweep values. See examples. Default NULL. x_var Strings identify x-axis y-axis variables sensitivity graph. variables must appear .parametric_data. x_var must single string. y_var can vector strings. See examples. Re_terms string vector tells rebound terms include graph. Default unlist(ReboundTools::rebound_terms). line_var name variable used discriminate lines graph. Default y_names_col. y_names_col, y_vals_col See ReboundTools::graph_df_colnames. graph_params list parameters control graph appearance. See ReboundTools::sens_graph_params. point_type_colname, sweep_points, orig_points See ReboundTools::parametric_analysis_point_types.

title: Units for variables — rebound_var_units
text: .var_name variable name unit determined. service_unit energy service unit case (string). energy_engr_unit engineering unit energy (string). escape_latex boolean tells whether encode result LaTeX output. surround_left, surround_right, leading_delta_pattern, energy_si, time_unit, inverse_time_unit, currency, currency_latex, unitless, unitless_latex See ReboundTools::rebound_units. service_unit_name, energy_engr_unit_name, energy_converter, p_E_engr_units, k, I_E, r See ReboundTools::eeu_base_params. trim_stage_pattern regex trims rebound stage variable name. Default "[^]*$", trims characters beyond last "_" string. p_E, p_s, q_dot_s, eta_engr_units, efficiency, sigma, rho, income_rate, income, freed_cash_rate, freed_cash, energy arguments describe string prefixes identify variables unit determination. S_dot_dev, G_dot, f_Cs See ReboundTools::star_vars. arguments describe string patterns identify variables unit determination. elasticities, time, cost_rate, cost, energy_rate, rebound, tau_alpha, tau_omega arguments identify variable names.

ggplot2::scale_colour_manual(values = c(Re_tot = "black"), guide = "none") +   ggplot2::scale_discrete_manual(aesthetic = "linewidth",                                  values = c(Re_tot = 0.5), guide = "none") +   ggplot2::scale_linetype_manual(values = c(Re_tot = "solid"), guide = "none") +  ggplot2::labs(y = expression(Re[tot]),                 colour = ggplot2::element_blank(),                size = ggplot2::element_blank(),                linetype = ggplot2::element_blank())                  # A more complicated example that shows multi-variate sensitivity. # Values of the macro parameter (k) are shown in rows of the lattice plot. # Uncompensated price elasticity of energy service consumption (e_qs_ps_UC)  # is shown in columns of the lattice plot. # Total rebound (Re_tot) is given on the y-axis, and  # energy intensity of the economy (I_E) is given on the x-axis. # The cases (Car and Lamp) are shown as different lines. sens_params_2 <- list(Car = list(k = seq(0, 2, by = 0.5),                                 I_E = seq(2, 5, by = 1),                                 e_qs_ps_UC_orig = seq(-0.5, -0.1, by = 0.1)),                      Lamp = list(k = seq(0, 2, by = 0.5),                                 I_E = seq(2, 5, by = 1),                                  e_qs_ps_UC_orig = seq(-0.5, -0.1, by = 0.1))) # Choose which rebound variables to include and their order. sensitivity_graphs(rebound_data = df, parameterization = sens_params_2,                     x_var = "I_E",                     y_var = "Re_tot",                    line_var = "Case") +   ggplot2::facet_grid(rows = ggplot2::vars(k),                        cols = ggplot2::vars(e_qs_ps_UC_orig), scales = "free_y") +   ggplot2::scale_colour_manual(values = c(Car = "black", Lamp = "red")) +    ggplot2::scale_discrete_manual(aesthetic = "linewidth",                                  values = c(Car = 0.5, Lamp = 1.0)) +    ggplot2::scale_linetype_manual(values = c(Car = "solid", Lamp = "dashed")) +    ggplot2::labs(colour = ggplot2::element_blank(),                  linewidth = ggplot2::element_blank(),                 linetype = ggplot2::element_blank())   # Plot all rebound terms as a function of post-upgrade efficiency sens_params_3 <- list(Car = list(eta_engr_units_star = seq(35, 50, by = 0.5)),                        Lamp = list(eta_engr_units_star = seq(70, 90, by = 5))) # Choose rebound terms to include in the graph and their order rebound_vars <- c("Re_dempl", "Re_emb", "Re_omd", "Re_dsub", "Re_isub",                    "Re_dinc", "Re_iinc", "Re_macro")                    sensitivity_graphs(rebound_data = df,                     parameterization = sens_params_3,                    x_var = "eta_engr_units_tilde",                     y_var = rebound_vars) +    ggplot2::facet_wrap(facets = "Case", scales = "free_x") +   ggplot2::scale_colour_manual(values =          c(Re_dempl = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$dempl_colour,           Re_emb = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$emb_colour,           Re_md = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$md_colour,            Re_dsub = ReboundTools::path_graph_params$dsub_colour,           Re_isub = code: stages_table(   .analysis_data,   include_description_column = FALSE,   include_tilde_stage = TRUE,   add_units = TRUE,   escape_latex = TRUE,   visibility_mask = ReboundTools::stages_table_visibility_mask,   vars = ReboundTools::key_analysis_vars,   latex_vars = ReboundTools::latex_key_analysis_vars,   stages = ReboundTools::rebound_stages,   latex_stages = ReboundTools::latex_rebound_stages,   case = ReboundTools::eeu_base_params$case,   service_unit = ReboundTools::eeu_base_params$service_unit,   energy_engr_unit = ReboundTools::eeu_base_params$energy_engr_unit,   tilde_stage = ReboundTools::rebound_stages$tilde,   ...,   visible = "Visible",   description = "description",   var_name = "var_name",   latex_var_name = "latex_var_name",   .var = ".var",   .stage = ".stage",   .var_stage = ".var_stage",   .value = ".value",   .name = ".name",   .unit_col = ".unit_col",   orig = ReboundTools::rebound_stages$orig,   star = ReboundTools::rebound_stages$star,   hat = ReboundTools::rebound_stages$hat,   bar = ReboundTools::rebound_stages$bar,   tilde = ReboundTools::rebound_stages$tilde )

title: Build a stages table — stages_table
text: .analysis_data data frame, usually result calling rebound_analysis(). include_description_column boolean tells whether include description column left. include_tilde_stage boolean tells whether include tilde column, identical bar column. add_units TRUE (default), adds unit specification variable names table. escape_latex TRUE (default), return LaTeX-compatible versions strings. visibility_mask data frame tells data visible stages_table(). Default stages_table_visibility_mask, value shows variables changes . see variables, set NULL. Modify stages_table_visibility_mask needed. vars list variables rows table. Default key_analysis_vars. Variable order preserved table. latex_vars See ReboundTools::latex_key_analysis_vars. Set NULL prevent conversion LaTeX variable names. stages list stages columns table. Default rebound_stages. Stage order preserved table. latex_stages See latex_rebound_stages. Set NULL prevent conversion LaTeX stage names. case See eeu_base_params. service_unit, energy_engr_unit See ReboundTools::eeu_base_params. tilde_stage Used internally identify tilde column. Default rebound_stages$tilde. ... Arguments passed xtable::xtable(), possibly label, caption, digits, etc. visible name column stages_table_visibility_mask data frame. description, var_name, latex_var_name Names columns latex_vars data frame. .var, .stage, .var_stage, .value, .name, .unit_col Column names used internally. orig, star, hat, bar, tilde Rebound stages. See rebound_stages.

title: EEU star data — star_vars
code: star_vars

title: EEU star data — star_vars
text: string list 31 entries. tau_alpha_star post-emplacement discount multiplier beginning--life expenses, capital cost. tau_omega_star post-emplacement discount multiplier end--life expenses, disposal cost. C_cap_star net capital expenditure upgraded device: sum purchase price financing costs less rebates resale value end ownership [$]. C_dot_md_star upgraded (post-EEU) maintenance disposal expenditure rate [$/yr]. E_emb_star embodied energy upgraded (post-EEU) device [MJ]. t_life_star expected lifetime upgraded (post-EEU) device [yr]. eta_engr_units_star upgraded (post-EEU) energy service efficiency. number engineering units denominator, e.g., [miles/gallon] [lumens/kW]. Note denominator unit eta_engr_units_orig assumed denominator unit MJ_engr_unit. eta_star Energy service efficiency upgraded (post-EEU) device per-MJ basks [service/MJ], calculated eta_tilde_engr_units / MJ_engr_unit. eta_ratio energy service efficiency ratio [–], calculated eta_star/eta_orig. S_dot_dev expected device-level energy savings rate [MJ/yr], calculated (eta_ratio - 1) * (1/eta_ratio) * E_dot_s_orig. G_dot expected device-level energy gross cost savings rate [MJ/yr], calculated p_E * S_dot_dev. p_s_star upgraded (post-EEU) energy service price [$/service], calculated p_E / eta_star = p_E / eta_tilde. q_dot_s_star upgraded (post-EEU) energy service consumption rate [service/yr], q_dot_s_orig. C_dot_cap_star capital expenditure rate device without discounting [$/yr], calculated C_cap/t_life. tau_alpha_C_dot_cap_star product tau_alpha undiscounted capital cost rate, annualized discounted [$/yr]. C_dot_om_star operations maintenance expenditure rate device [$/yr]. C_d_star disposal cost device [$/yr]. C_dot_d_star disposal cost rate device without discounting [$/yr]. tau_omega_C_dot_d_star product tau_omega undiscounted disposal cost rate, annualized discounted [$/yr]. C_dot_omd_star operations, maintenance, disposal expenditure rate device [$/yr]. E_dot_emb_star upgraded (post-EEU) embodied energy rate [MJ/yr], calculated E_emb_star / t_star. C_dot_s_star upgraded (post-EEU) energy expenditure rate [$/yr], calculated p_s_star * q_dot_s_star. M_dot_star disposable income rate, exclusive taxes savings [$/yr], exactly M_dot_orig. N_dot_star freed cash rate [$/yr], calculated G_dot - (C_dot_cap_star - C_dot_cap_orig) - (C_dot_md_star - C_dot_md_orig). C_dot_g_star upgraded (post-EEU) goods expenditure rate [$/yr], exactly C_dot_g_orig. f_Cs_star upgraded (post-EEU) fraction energy budget spent energy service [–], calculated C_dot_s_star / (C_dot_s_star + C_dot_g_star). e_qs_ps_C_star upgraded (post-EEU) compensated energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") energy service ("qs") consumption [–], calculated e_qs_ps_UC_orig + f_Cs_orig*e_qs_M. e_qg_ps_C_star upgraded (post-EEU) compensated energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") goods ("qo") consumption [–], calculated f_Cs_orig*(f_Cs_orig + e_qs_ps_UC_orig) / (f_Cs_orig - 1). e_qs_ps_UC_star upgraded (post-EEU) uncompensated ("UC") Marshallian energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") energy service ("qs") consumption (-price elasticity) [–]. e_qg_ps_UC_star upgraded (post-EEU) uncompensated ("UC") Marshallian energy service price ("ps") elasticity ("e") goods ("qo") consumption (cross-price elasticity) [–]. p_E_star price energy [$/MJ], E_dot_s_star upgraded (post-EEU) energy consumption rate [MJ/yr], calculated q_dot_s_star / eta_star.

title: ReboundTools 0.1.42 (2025-05-25)

Changed order rows stages_table() visually pleasing. stages_table() new argument visibility_mask specifies values show. term adjusting time-value money (R) changed Greek letter tau. subscript “o” goods services consumption changed “g” throughout match nomenclature change first paper using framework. Now 519 tests, passing. Test coverage remains 100%.
